pros: People are kind-hearted and well-intentioned, a great starting job.
cons: Need more business-minded guidance and training for upper management.

pros: In-house training for staff is held frequently, emphasizing practical skill development, which builds the confidence of employees. They have a positive team-player environment, and are quite supportive of their employees leading healthy and active lifestyles. The benefit of the pool and gym access was a big bonus feature for me!
cons: Definitely felt a lack of two-way communication between front line staff and upper management. Eg. some chronic problems could be fixed very quickly/easily because front-line staff are facing the same issues every day (and usually have great advice to resolve the problems), but upper management fails to use this resource, resulting in issues either progressing, getting a “band-aid quick fix”, or never being resolved. Issues range from broken/faulty equipment to internal organizational processes. Staff tend to feel either frustrated at this, or their workplace motivation decreases, resulting in decreased work performance.

review_title: Great Work/Life Balance, But Discourages Growth
pros:
- Fantastic work/life balance, encouraged to leave on time and not take work home 
- Free unlimited access to fitness facility for myself and my partner
- Pay wasn't high, but better than most non-profits in the city 
- Strong values and good variety of programs to benefit the community
cons:
- Structure is flat, discourages growth. Lack of opportunities for movement within
- Pay for roles is set, unable to negotiate salary even after working there for many years
- It is a great environment for those looking for a "cushy" job, but would not recommend to driven individuals looking for growth. I often felt restricted to existing processes and was discouraged from thinking outside the box

review_title: Good atmosphere for jobseekers seeking stability
pros:
Friendly staff and upper management,
Good pay and benefits,
Flexible schedule,
Stability (perfect for people who are not looking to learn new things and comfortable where they are professionally).
cons:
Training/familiarisation: low (not suitable for those hoping to improve themselves through on the job learning),
Few advancement opportunities (flat,horizontal structure),
Favourtism,
Lack of efficient procedures and reluctance/resistence on their improvement (common trait in nonprofits),
Management level employees may hold a number of titles concurrently (attention divided, unspecialised).

pros: The staff are friendly, it has the potential to be a great job, benefits are decent
cons: My manager is rarely available, the staff are petty with each other, older staff members are treated poorly, health and wellbeing of staff members is not respected, you're regularly in unsafe situations with no support.   The pay is not great.
